textos_fuente.text: Contact | West TN Strawberry Festival Home MENU about schedule register gallery FAQ contact parade lineup merchandise TICKETS Home about schedule of events register gallery faq merchandise parade lineup contact tickets West Tennessee Strawberry Festival & Humboldt Chamber 1200 Main Street Humboldt, Tennessee 38343 Location contact M-F 8:00am-4:30pm Hours 731-784-1842 Phone Socialize festival@humboldtchamber.com Email Send The best way to get in touch with us is by filling out the form below. Someone on our team will get back to you within 24 business hours. You can also email us at festival@humboldtchamber.com Contact Us Today! Someone on our team will get back to you within 24 business hours! Your message has been sent successfully! frequently asked questions What are the times for the Carnival? We keep the carnival information up to date on our website. Find all the carnival info here! How do I register for a parade? Click here to visit our registration page. Select either Grand Floats Parade or Junior Floats Parade to open that specific registration form. Where do I go to lineup for the parades? Click here for line up directions for the parades! What time do the parades start? The Junior Floats parade on Thursday May 11th begins at 10am.  The Grand Floats parade on Friday May 12th begins at 10am. Where do I park when visiting Main Street? The City of Humboldt offers several public parking lots right off of main street.  12th Ave directly behind the Mayor’s Office, as well as the corner of Burrow Street and 14th Ave.  Main Street closes promptly at 9am on parade days, parking is available on the filtering streets that lead to Main Street and visitors are encouraged to get to town early. Where should I sit for the parades? Seating is available all along the parade route, from 22nd and Main all the way to 12th Ave.  Find a group of friends and add your chair! How can i be involved? The West Tennessee Strawberry Festival has more than 20 events that require LOTS of volunteers to help make happen! Send us an email or click the "contact us" button below if you would like to get plugged into one of our committees! Helpful links carnival info parade registration schedule find it fast: Schedule of Events Sponsors Carnival Questions The 87th annual west tennessee strawberry festival is sunday, may 4th saturday, may 10th to WEBSITE + BRAND DESIGN CREDIT  |  Copyright © 2018 west tennessee strawberry festival/Humboldt Chamber of commerce

Campgrounds Schedule of Events Special Days & Discounts Sponsorship Official Partners Strawberry Central Tickets Vendors, Exhibitors & Concessionaires About Us Board of Directors History Florida Strawberry Festival® History Center & Strawberry Queens Exhibit Royalty Florida Strawberry Festival Queen’s Scholarship Pageant Junior Royalty Pageant News Press Releases Contact Us Administrative Office Maintenance Media Ticket Office Sweet Shortcuts TICKET INFORMATION Box Office The Florida Strawberry Festival® Solution Source Construction Box Office is located east of the GT Grandstands, near the southwest corner of the TECO Expo Hall. For more information about events at the Florida Strawberry Festival®, please call the box office at 813.754.1996. FLORIDA STRAWBERRY FESTIVAL® SOLUTION SOURCE CONSTRUCTION BOX OFFICE POLICY- The Florida Strawberry Festival® Solution Source Construction Box Office accepts payment in the form of VISA, MasterCard, American Express, Discover, and cash. There are no refunds and no exchanges on any ticket purchased for a Florida Strawberry Festival® headline entertainment concert.  In the event that a show is canceled or rescheduled, please contact the original point of purchase. WILL CALL Artist Will Call Artists’ representatives will disclose to the Solution Source Construction Box Office their will-call information one hour prior to showtime. The Festival has no knowledge of individuals listed on the Artist’s Will Call sheet until provided on the day of performance. All individuals listed will be notified by the Artist, Artist’s representative or personnel affiliated with the Artist prior to performance. All patrons must stop by the  Solution Source Construction Box Office Will Call window located under the GT Grandstands, at the southwest corner of the TECO Expo Hall to receive their tickets unless otherwise instructed by an Artist’s representative. A valid photo ID must be presented at the time of pick up. Solution Source Construction Box Office Will Call Tickets purchased after February 2, 2026 may be picked up at the Will Call window located at the Florida Strawberry Festival® Solution Source Construction Box Office on the day of the concert, or during our 11-day event. All patrons must stop by the  Solution Source Construction Box Office Will Call window located under the GT Grandstands, at the southwest corner of the TECO Expo Hall to receive their tickets unless otherwise instructed. Patrons must present a valid photo ID  to receive tickets. All tickets purchased over the phone are mailed out no later than February 2, 2026. Tickets purchased after that date will be held for pick up at the Solution Source Construction  Box Office. SOLUTION SOURCE STADIUM BOX OFFICE HOURS Beginning December 1, 2025, the Solution Source Construction Box Office will be open to receive telephone inquiries Monday through Thursday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. The Solution Source Construction Box Office will be available for concert ticket sales from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. during the 11-day event. Beginning January 5, 2026, the Solution Source Construction Box Office will be open to receive telephone inquiries Monday through Thursday from 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., and Friday from 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. Online ticket ordering is available 24/7. AMSCOT TICKET OFFICE HOURS Beginning December 11, 2025, the Amscot Ticket Office located at 2209 West Oak Avenue will be open during the 2026 event from Monday through Thursday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. General admission and concert ticket sales are available for purchase during the 2026 Festival. HOLIDAY HOURS The Florida Strawberry Festival® is closed on major holidays unless an event is taking place on our grounds. Solution Source Construction Box Office hours may vary on holidays. Please call 813.752.9194 for exact hours of operation. Click here to purchase headline entertainment tickets. GENERAL INFORMATION Ticket Office: (813) 754-1996 ADA & Group Sales: (813) 719-6680 Fax: (813) 754-4297 Attn: Ticket Office AMSCOT MAIN TICKET GATE ADDRESS 2209 West Oak Avenue Plant City, FL 33563 Google Maps TICKET OFFICE ADMIN CONTACT Brittanie Mallard Ticket Office Manager EMAIL INQUIRIES Click on the link below for ticket inquires. CUSTOMER SERVICE For more information about tickets purchased through Etix call, 1.800.514.3849. Join our email list! Click to Subscribe Click here for Festival preferred hotels. Get a TRUE taste of old Florida at the Floral City Strawberry Festival, held annually, the first weekend in March. The rich and fertile spring-fed soil of Citrus County is known for producing remarkably delicious fruit. Every year, The Floral City Strawberry Festival celebrates its tasty namesake with a full weekend of fun that has been a local tradition for generations. Saturday morning, the festival opens with the posting of Colors, the Pledge of Allegiance, and our National Anthem. Followed by another annual tradition â The Strawberry Princess Pageants. The weekend continues as over 200 booths filled with crafts, artists, local non-profits, and commercial vendors offer their wares in colorfully decorated booths throughout Floral Park. Choosing what to eat is never an easy decision as the smell of barbecue, seafood, and a wide variety of festival food will fill the air. Wonderful, tasty, sweet treats too â ice cream, frozen smoothies, frozen fruit pops, craft sodas, and homemade pretzels are just some perennial festival fares. The Beer & Wine Garden by the main stage will offer multiple selections, while musical talent entertains everyone. Children always have so much to do at the Floral City Strawberry Festival. Let the kids blow off some steam at the extensive variety of inflatables, bounce houses, and other kidâs activities. One festival classic, not to be missed, is the extremely messy pie-eating contests, held both days. All can compete, even the little ones, in age-appropriate categories. Sign-up onsite at the festival both mornings. Then there is the star of the Floral City Strawberry Festival. Freshly picked strawberries, warm from the Florida sun and supplied by our very own Ferris Farms. Hundreds of flats of strawberries made into delectable strawberry shortcakes for all to enjoy, and plenty of flats of strawberries available to go. Flats will be available next to the Strawberry Shortcake tent, at each gate, and at the shuttle bus parking lot at the County Auditorium ready for you to take home as a sweet reminder of the weekend. Festival History Local sources indicate that the 1 st Annual Strawberry Festival was held in March of 1988. By its 3 rd anniversary, when the Chamber became involved with its production, the festival hard grown large enough to move from the original location, in the Ferris Grove lot, to Floral Park where it has been held every year since 1990. Salute to Local Agriculture! At its core, the Floral City Strawberry Festival is a genuine salute to our local agriculture. According to the Agriculture Alliance of Citrus County, agriculture is an important component of the cultural and economic environment in Citrus County and its continued vitality is beneficial for all residents. Additionally, Citrus Countyâs agricultural lands provide a broad spectrum of environmental benefits such as: green space, preservation of wetlands, water storage, ground water recharge, protection of well fields, water filtration, flood control, purification of air, carbon sequestering, generation of oxygen. Additional benefits of agriculture include: preservation of wildlife habitat, (including habitat for a wide, variety of birds and threatened and endangered species), a buffer between urban development and natural areas, forests and woodlands, and scenic views. © 2025 Citrus County Chamber of Commerce | Site by GrowthZone Get In Touch! Florida Strawberry Festival names new ‘red coats’ | Plant City Observer Skip to main content Skip to primary sidebar Skip to footer Thursday, September 11, 2025 - 76° Health Calendar Cops Corner Real Estate Contests E-Editions Plant City Observer Plant City News and Real Estate News Business Your Town Neighbors Around Town ClubHubbub Creative Space Faith Obituaries Relay for Life Florida Strawberry Festival Schools Opinion Sports High Schools Athlete of the Week Youth Sports Gridiron Report Photos Videos News October 24, 2019 6:50 am Florida Strawberry Festival names new ‘red coats’ By Justin Kline Two new directors and two new associate directors were elected by the festival’s board of directors. Share This Post Facebook Pinterest Twitter Linkedin The lineup of “red coats” of the Florida Strawberry Festival got a new look this month, and the changes now have officially been announced. The festival board welcomed Dr. Michael Salvato and Chris Sparkman aboard as directors, and Calvin “Pee Wee” Callins Sr. and Brian Shepherd were named associate directors. These fresh faces will replace outgoing directors Mike Sparkman, Ken Lucas and Ron Gainey, who are transitioning to directors emeriti and will still be considered active members. Chris Sparkman Calvin Callins Dr. Michael Salvato Brian Shepherd The board selects new directors from its currently active group of associate directors, and it pulls from a group of nominated candidates to select new associate directors. The board is comprised of 16 directors and 14 associate directors. “We are incredibly honored to have had so many outstanding nominees,” Florida Strawberry Festival Chairman Dub McGinnes said. “It was difficult to select just four.” online pharmacy zestril for sale no prescription pharmacy All four men have plenty of experience with the festival. online pharmacy purchase naprosyn without prescription with best prices today in the USA Salvato, an associate director of the last 16 years who has been involved in many of its committees, is well-known as the festival’s “on-call physician.” Sparkman, an associate director of the last 12 years, has been a volunteer since 1993 and has been heavily involved on the musical side with the headline entertainment and stadium operations committees. “I’m extremely proud to be part of such a great organization,” Sparkman said. “I hope to continue the tradition of providing family-focused entertainment for many years to come.” Shepherd has volunteered with the festival for more than 25 years and is active in its agricultural scene, having served on the youth plant show and sale committee, steer committee, swine committee and agriculture committee. Callins has done everything from stadium operations and vehicle parking to working on the Battle of the Bands committee and even performing, having headlined the Gospel Night series since 2014. “I hope to contribute to the family feeling the festival offers its guests,” Callins said. “The festival is a place for everyone to come experience Plant City.” The moves are the first directorial appointments by the festival’s new executive board, which was installed in mid-April. That includes new chairman McGinnes, director Andy Knotts, associate directors Brian West and Lori Yarbrough, vice chair Phil Waldron, secretary Danny Coton and treasurer Pam Warnock. online pharmacy buy minocin no prescription with best prices today in the USA “The impact that the Florida Strawberry Festival and its leaders have made on me and my family is immeasurable,” Shepherd said. “I am overwhelmed by the confidence of the board of directors and look forward to serving our community in this capacity.” The 2020 Florida Strawberry Festival will run from Feb. 27 through March 8, 2020. Visit flstrawberryfestival.com or its social media profiles on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for more information.
